male.coat_color: Iron-grey, with white patches around the eyes and above the muzzle. Some may be light to dark grey, fawn, or white.
male.horn_shape: Backward curving like Mysore cattle, ending in sharp points.

female.coat_color: Iron-grey, with white patches around the eyes and above the muzzle. Some may be light to dark grey, fawn, or white.
female.horn_shape: Backward curving like Mysore cattle, ending in sharp points.

male.coat_color: Grey, with shades from almost white to black. White-grey marks or patches may be present on the face and dewlap. Darker shades can be on the neck, shoulder, hump, and hindquarters.
male.horn_shape: Long horns that are close together, go backward and upward, and then turn inward with sharp black points.

female.coat_color: Grey, with shades from almost white to black. White-grey marks or patches may be present on the face and dewlap. Darker shades can be on the neck, shoulder, hump, and hindquarters.
female.horn_shape: Long horns that are close together, go backward and upward, and then turn inward with sharp black points.

male.coat_color: White with dark red or reddish-brown spots and speckles.

female.coat_color: White with dark red or reddish-brown spots and speckles.

male.coat_color: Mainly black, sometimes copper-coloured.

female.coat_color: Mainly black, sometimes copper-coloured.

male.coat_color: Brown with white patches, though some can be all white or all brown.

female.coat_color: Brown with white patches, though some can be all white or all brown.

male.origin: Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh, India
male.coat_color: Copper-coloured and grayish-black, with two white lines ('Chevron') on the lower side of the neck.
male.horn_shape: Curled slightly outward, then downward before running backward parallel to the neck, finally turning upward.

female.origin: Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh, India
female.coat_color: Copper-coloured and grayish-black, with two white lines ('Chevron') on the lower side of the neck.
female.horn_shape: Curled slightly outward, then downward before running backward parallel to the neck, finally turning upward.

male.coat_color: Light grayish-brown, but can range from nearly white to dark brown. The muzzle is black with a creamy white ring.
male.horn_shape: Horned, but mainly dehorned as calves.

female.coat_color: Light grayish-brown, but can range from nearly white to dark brown. The muzzle is black with a creamy white ring.
female.horn_shape: Horned, but mainly dehorned as calves.

male.coat_color: White with red or black spots.
male.horn_shape: Short and thick, with lateral pointing tips. Tips may also point inward or downward.

female.coat_color: White with red or black spots.
female.horn_shape: Short and thick, with lateral pointing tips. Tips may also point inward or downward.

male.coat_color: The majority are red, but they can be yellow, white, black, or have white spotted coats.

male.coat_color: White to light grey.
male.horn_shape: Emerge close together from the poll, go straight upward and backward, then slightly forward and inward with pointed tips.

female.coat_color: White to light grey.

male.horn_shape: Horned, though many are now polled.

male.coat_color: Calves are born red but turn grey by age two. Bulls are darker and may be black on the head and foreparts. Cows are grey or dark grey, and become completely white as they age.
male.horn_shape: Two horn types: one with a slight backward curve, and a larger variety with longer horns that curve outward and backward, forming nearly a full circle.

female.coat_color: Calves are born red but turn grey by age two. Cows are grey or dark grey, and become completely white as they age.
female.horn_shape: Two horn types: one with a slight backward curve, and a larger variety with longer horns that curve outward and backward, forming nearly a full circle.

male.coat_color: Compact and tight white skin, but the Deccan plateau, Mhaswad, and Atpadi Mahal types are grayish white. The Tapi Khillar is white with a carroty nose and hooves, while the Nakali Khillar is gray with tawny or brick dust color over the forequarters.

female.coat_color: Compact and tight white skin, but the Deccan plateau, Mhaswad, and Atpadi Mahal types are grayish white. The Tapi Khillar is white with a carroty nose and hooves, while the Nakali Khillar is gray with tawny or brick dust color over the forequarters.
